intro: Lachnastoma densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered lichen, is a species of lichen that exhibits unique botanical characteristics. It belongs to the family Lecanoraceae and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungal partner and a green alga or cyanobacterium. Its thallus is crustose, with a dense arrangement of apothecia that give it its common name. The structure and composition of Lachnastoma densiflora make it an important indicator species for environmental conditions.
